item.title: Photonic Guandao
item.description: Requires 2 modification points to install. 5 energy damage, double damage against impaired targets, accurate. Threat range 2.

item.title: Communication
item.description: No known form of communication can travel faster than light, instead messages are carried by ships moving between systems. By default ships entering a new system download an updated version of relevant information when connecting to the local datasphere, and provide these updates as they travel to other systems.

item.title: Emerald Harrier
item.description: A light combat mech produced by the Florian League. The J-Series are designed to be an affordable version which they sell to external parties. Size: 1/2 Armor: 0 Save Target: 10 Sensors: 9 E-Defense: 8 Tech Attack: +0 HP: 10 Evasion: 9 Heat Cap: 4 Speed: 5 Two Weapon Mounts (default two rotator canons) Rotator Canon: Range 10, 1d6 damage, become accurate if firing at same target for two turns Available Modifications Smoke Charge - Quick Action, size 2 soft cover for 1 turn Projected Shield - protocol, 2 penalty dice to and from a single target Smart Missiles - main weapon, 1d6 damage, smart Expanded Compartment - can carry an additional pilot or payload Deployable Cover - quick action, place 8 HP hard cover Bombard Canon - arcing, inaccurate, range 15, 1d6+1 damage.

item.title: Episode 8 - Independent People's Republic of Galt
item.description: Under the guise of a delivery mission the crew discover the people of idyllic Gelland are held hostage by their own government, meanwhile the Katangan’s puppets are the barbarians at the gates.

item.title: Episode 7 - Scrapyard Jump
item.description: The crew return to Tartakover after their first successful mission, but nothing stops the mortgage. The crew learn of a number of leads: go on an uninsured ‘trade’ mission to the I’Sred*Ni, try to rob the Monarchy of Lod’s gigantic flagship, fight pirates in the Marrakesh subsector, or get in deep debt to find a Jump-3 drive to deliver aid to the people of Balleau.

item.title: Episode 6 - The Entity at Tyren
item.description: The crew signs on the dotted line. The price of freedom is 3,000 credits per month. Plus fuel. And repairs. But the High and Dry is officially decommissioned by the Scout Service and in the hands of independent owners.

item.title: Episode 5 - Tartakover
item.description: The crew watch a bank heist go wrong and contemplate how to get some credits. The Scout Service offers to sell the ship at a discounted rate, but the crew are still short for even a down payment on a 250,000 credit purchase.

item.title: Episode 4 - Volcano
item.description: The travelers perform a heroic rescue and are thanked by the people of Chubbuck. Alongside the people the High and Dry saves two containers of quasi-legal antimatter stored in the volcano.

item.title: Episode 3 - Chubbuck Mountain
item.description: Travelers fight locust, local scrappers, altitude sickness, and wild beasts to secure the High and Dry atop Mount Chubbuck.
